comments:
This course is the last of three organic chemistry courses required for chemistry majors. It uses “Experimental Organic Chemistry” by Gilbert as its main textbook. It covers topics including modern chromatographic, instrumental and spectroscopic techniques.

Most students said that they learned a lot from the class and were “proud” of their “progress.” However, one point of contention was that most students learned a lot from the readings and not so much from the professor.

Professor Mallory was outstanding, according to many students. The lectures were extremely beneficial for the class, though some students had problems with the labs. Many students specifically said “Dr. Mallory has perfected this course.”

All the students thought the class was far too much work for one credit units. It involved 9 hours of class time, no including time spent on homework. While intensive, the class was targeted specifically for Chemistry majors and had an extremely steep curve, making it difficult to get a good grade.
